result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: OFF THE RECORD / 11:01 AM Defendant Christopher Lamar Palmer not in court.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Christopher Lamar Palmer.  Attorney Bruce Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.   DEF did not appear,  Warrant remains active.   If DEF wants to schedule voluntary, DEF must appear in person.
Voluntary appearance on October 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:22 AM Defendant Christopher Lamar Palmer appeared by video.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Christopher Lamar Palmer.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Novak comments on DEF non-appearance for last hearing, DEF tested positive for COVID and Atty Novak did submit the test results. State objects to video appearance of the DEF. Atty Novak makes statement. Court makes statement that the DEF must be in person if he wishes to make a voluntary appearance. Voluntary Appearance scheduled. State requests for the Warrant to be quashed, Atty Novak states for the record that he wishes for the warrant to be quashed. Warrant remains active until next voluntary appearance in person.
Voluntary appearance scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Voluntary appearance on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.
Voluntary appearance on September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Medical record showing COVID positive

8:50 AM  Defendant Christopher Lamar Palmer not in court.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Christopher Lamar Palmer.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Novack no contact.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Wisconsin and Surrounding States) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:17 AM Defendant Christopher Lamar Palmer appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Christopher Lamar Palmer.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Novack  indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, Sawyer County Sgt Hall, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.     10:30 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  10:39 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Novack.   Court addresses DEF, as to outbursts.  10:51 AM Attny Novack no further questions.  10:51 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Novack request case be dismissed and makes argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order

NO CONTACT with N.S. 09/02/1985

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

2:51 PM Defendant Christopher Lamar Palmer appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Christopher Lamar Palmer.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court indicates victim requested to be at hearing, no victim appeared. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court reviewed criminal complaint.   Counsel makes statement regarding Count 6, regarding basis for charge, and reserve plea on Count 6.   Court reserves plea on Count 6. Through Counsel DEF enters NG Plea Counts 3, 4, 5.   DEF agrees.  Court receives pleas.    Through Counsel, DEF request preliminary hearing to set within time limits.   Attny Novack request bond modification.  State does not object.   State request bond reduction to CBS $2500.  Attny Novack updates DEF address.   Attny Novack makes bond argument.    Court sets bond.   Amended bond  CBS $2500   Conditions will remain the same.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:14 AM DEF Christopher Palmer in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail. Attorney Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) by zoom. Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE declined for public defender.  Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation. State discusses the reasoning for the bond recommendation. Court address Atty Pollak on information, Pollak has no information for the court. Court addresses the DEF on availability of a public defender. Court has discussion on wanting the DEF to speak to a public defender prior to setting a bond. State makes a statement that the victim has been in contact with the DA office and wants clarification on the status of the Defendant. 11:25 AM OFF RECORD - Atty Pollak and DEF in breakout room for discussion. 11:29 AM ON RECORD Atty Pollak states he spoke with the DEF and would like to return on Monday . Court finds probable cause and will be held until the next court date.
